title: Jeremy Hardy celebrates fourth decade of stand-up with new show
text:
0 comments 
NOT just that man on the radio, but a veteran stand-up comedian of more than 30 years’ experience, Jeremy Hardy is travelling the country with a show full of comedy and wit, and stops in at The Lights in Andover on Wednesday, October 28 at 8pm. 
He is perhaps best remembered as a much younger man, but there is nothing he can do about that now. Still alive and able to speak unaided for lengthy periods, his act will be not so much a one-man show as an under-staffed cavalcade. 
“In an ideal world, Jeremy Hardy would be extremely famous, but an ideal world would leave him without most of his best material.” (The Guardian) Jeremy is now an essential member of BBC Radio 4’s The News Quiz and is a regular guest on I’m Sorry I Haven’t a Clue and Just a Minute. 
He has also done various bits of television, most notably, Now Something Else with Rory Bremner, Saturday Live, Blackadder Goes Forth, Loose Talk, Jack and Jeremy’s Real Lives with Jack Dee and If I Ruled the World with Graeme Garden and Clive Anderson. Share article 
To find out more call into The Lights and pick up a brochure.
